title: Integrated Context-Aware Language Class Observation Process Through Learning Analytics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital learning tools, understanding of core language education concepts (grammar, vocabulary, text analysis, academic writing), and intermediate or higher domain-specific expertise
context.additional_context: A mobile microlearning program for mid-level professionals in medical/legal/technical fields, targeting language proficiency (discipline-specific reading/writing, academic writing, grammar application).

learning_goals: Learners develop the ability to interpret contextual elements (text structure, vocabulary patterns, grammar application) of language class observation data using learning analytics.
Learners contribute to improving language learning analytics models by applying participatory design techniques and develop strategies to enhance learners' writing and reading skills.

Through focus group interviews, learners collaborate with peer teachers to develop strategies for using class observation tools and explore methods to improve learners' expressive and reading abilities.
Learners describe the process of integrating language class observation data (pronunciation, sentence structure, vocabulary selection) into multimodal learning analytics datasets.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
